Put the device in pairing mode, then tap Continue to add it to Calix.

Please Accept the Terms and Conditions
Calix Gigamanage is an intuitive, easy-to-use mobile application that lets subscribers set up a guest Wi-Fi network, set parental controls, provide basic policy management.

CALIX, INC. 
GIGAMANAGE” END USER LICENSE AGREEMENT


THIS END USER LICENSE AGREEMENT (“CALIX GIGAMANAGE”) IS AN AGREEMENT BETWEEN CALIX, INC. (“CALIX”) AND YOU AS END USER (“YOU” OR “END USER”) FOR RIGHTS TO USE CALIX GIGAMANAGE (“SOFTWARE”) PROVIDED BY CALIX. THIS Calix Gingamanage IS LIMITED TO THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT.


CALIX EXPRESSLY REJECTS ANY TERMS OR CONDITIONS THAT ARE NOT SET FORTH IN THIS Calix Gingamanage. PLEASE READ THE Calix Gingamanage CAREFULLY AS IT IS LEGALLY BINDING. BY DOWNLOADING, INSTALLING OR USING THE SOFTWARE, YOU ACCEPT THE TERMS OF THE Calix Gingamanage. IF YOU ARE ACCEPTING THESE TERMS ON BEHALF OF ANOTHER PERSON OR A COMPANY OR OTHER LEGAL ENTITY, YOU REPRESENT AND WARRANT THAT YOU HAVE FULL AUTHORITY TO ACT FOR AND TO BIND THAT PERSON, COMPANY, OR LEGAL ENTITY TO THESE TERMS. IF YOU DO NOT HAVE SUCH AUTHORITY, OR IF YOU DO NOT AGREE WITH THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS, YOU MUST NOT ACCEPT THIS Calix Gingamanage AND MAY NOT USE THE SOFTWARE.



1. Permitted Use; Term. 
1.1 Subject to the terms and conditions of this Calix Gingamanage, Calix hereby grants End User, during the Term (as defined below), a non-exclusive, non-transferable, non-sublicenseable, limited right to access and use the Software solely in connection with one or more Calix offerings (including product, cloud service and/or software offerings) for End User’s network needs (the “Permitted Use”). This Calix Gingamanage does not entitle End User to any technical support with respect to the Software. Calix reserves the right to provide support in its sole discretion and at such terms as Calix shall in its sole discretion determine.


1.2 The “Term” shall begin upon End User’s download of the Software and shall continue until the earlier of (i) termination of this Calix Gingamanage by either party, or (ii) End User discontinuing use of the Software. Calix may immediately terminate this Calix Gingamanage for convenience or in the event End User breaches this Calix Gingamanage or any terms associated with Calix offerings in connection with the Permitted Use. End User agrees that a breach of this Calix Gingamanage shall constitute a material default for which Calix may have no adequate remedy at law, such that injunctive or other equitable relief may be appropriate to restrain such breach, whether threatened or actual. Upon termination of this Calix Gingamanage, the license granted to End User shall terminate and End User shall immediately discontinue using the Software. Upon request, End User will certify to Calix that it has deleted and/or destroyed all copies of the Software. In the event of expiration or termination of this Agreement, Sections 1.2, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 will survive and continue in effect.


2. Restrictions. 
2.1 End User shall not itself, or through any parent, subsidiary, affiliate, agent or other third party permit any third party to (i) use the Software other than for the Permitted Use; (ii) sell, lease, license, transfer, sublicense, make any external commercial use of or any way distribute the Software, (iii) provide, disclose, divulge or make available to, or permit use of the Software by any third party, (iv) copy, modify or reproduce, translate, reverse engineer, disassemble, decompile, or create derivative works based on, or copy the Software or any portion thereof, (v) directly or indirectly use the Software in any way to build a competitive product or service, (vi) modify any proprietary rights notices that appear in the Software or components thereof, or (vii) use the Software in violation of any applicable laws and regulations (including any export laws, restrictions, national security controls and regulations).


2.2 End User shall notify Calix promptly of any unauthorized use of any password or account or any other known or suspected breach of security or misuse of the Software. End User is responsible for use of the Software by any and all employees, or other users that it allows to access the Software.


3. Confidentiality 
3.1 “Confidential Information” means non-public information, technical data or know-how of a party and/or its affiliates, which is furnished to the other party in written or tangible form in connection with this Calix Gingamanage. Oral disclosure will also be deemed Confidential Information if it would reasonably be considered to be of a confidential nature or if it is confirmed at the time of disclosure to be confidential.


3.2 Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information does not include information which is: (i) already in the possession of the receiving party and not subject to a confidentiality obligation to the providing party; (ii) independently developed by the receiving party; (iii) publicly disclosed through no fault of the receiving party; (iv) rightfully received by the receiving party from a third party that is not under any obligation to keep such information confidential; (v) approved for release by written agreement with the disclosing party; or (vi) disclosed pursuant to the requirements of law, regulation, or court order, provided that the receiving party will promptly inform the providing party of any such requirement and cooperate with any attempt to reasonably limit such disclosure or to procure a protective order or similar treatment.


3.3 Neither party will use the other party’s Confidential Information except as reasonably required for the performance of this Calix Gingamanage. Each party will hold in confidence the other party’s Confidential Information by means that are no less restrictive than those used for its own confidential materials. Each party agrees not to disclose the other party’s Confidential Information to anyone other than its employees or subcontractors who are bound by confidentiality obligations and who need to know the same to perform such party’s obligations hereunder.


3.4 Upon termination or expiration of this Calix Gingamanage, except as otherwise agreed in writing or otherwise stated in this Calix Gingamanage, each party will, upon the request of the disclosing party, either: (i) return all of such Confidential Information of the disclosing party and all copies thereof in the receiving party’s possession or control to the disclosing party; or (ii) destroy all Confidential Information and all copies thereof in the receiving party’s possession or control. The receiving party will at the request of the disclosing party certify in writing that no copies have been retained by the receiving party, its employees or agents.


3.5 In case a party receives legal process that demands or requires disclosure of the disclosing party’s Confidential Information, such party will give prompt notice to the disclosing party, if legally permissible, to enable the disclosing party to challenge such demand.


3.6 The receiving party acknowledges that unauthorized disclosure of the disclosing party’s Confidential Information could cause substantial harm to the disclosing party for which damages alone might not be a sufficient remedy and, therefore, that upon any such disclosure by the receiving party the disclosing party will be entitled to appropriate equitable relief in addition to whatever other remedies it might have at law or equity.


4. User Data. 
4.1 End User is responsible for all data, information or material provided, submitted or otherwise transmitted by End User through the Software (“User Data”). End User will have the sole responsibility for the accuracy, quality, integrity, legality, reliability, appropriateness of and permissions for User Data. Except as described in this Calix Gingamanage, Calix will not access or disclose User Data other than as required by law or regulation.


4.2 End User represents and warrants that End User (i) has provided and will provide all legally required disclosures regarding User Data, including personally identifiable information and (ii) if applicable, has obtained and will obtain legally enforceable written consents to provide User Data, including personally identifiable information, to Calix to collect and use the User Data and any personally identifiable information as referenced in the Subscriber Data Collection and Usage documentation for the Software attached as Appendix A to this Calix Gingamanage, as may be updated by Calix from time to time.


4.3 Subject to the terms and conditions of this Calix Gingamanage, End User grants to Calix a non-exclusive worldwide license to host, copy, store, use, transmit and display User Data to the extent reasonably necessary to provide, maintain and/or enhance the Service. Calix will not use the User Data for any purpose other than (i) as provided in the applicable Subscriber Data Collection and Usage documentation, (ii) to provide and maintain the Software and, (iii) provided use is on an anonymous and/or aggregated basis, to enhance and/or evaluate the Software from time to time. End User agrees that continued use of the Software represents End User’s consent to the foregoing use by Calix unless End User provides formal written notice otherwise to Calix.


5. Proprietary Rights. 
5.1 Calix and its suppliers retain all rights, title and interest in the Software. This Calix Gingamanage grants no ownership rights to End User. No license is granted to End User except as to use of the Software as expressly stated herein. The Calix name, the Calix logo, and the product names associated with the Software are trademarks of Calix or third parties, and they may not be used without Calix’s prior written consent.


5.2 Open-Source Software. The Software may include third-party software licensed under terms different from those contained in this Calix Gingamanage. Portions of the Software may only be available to End User under public licenses (each a “Public License”). End User’s rights and obligations with respect to such Software are set forth in the applicable Public License and this Calix Gingamanage. Information about applicable Public Licenses and a copy of the applicable licensing provisions for the open source software used by Calix may be found in Appendix B to this Calix Gingamanage. End User either must agree to the provisions of each applicable Public License or not exercise such licensed rights. This Calix Gingamanage is not intended to change or restrict the terms of any Public License, and Calix does not seek to restrict, or receive compensation for, the copying or redistribution of publicly licensed code that is otherwise freely re-distributable to third parties (and not otherwise restricted by federal copyright or other laws). Calix disclaims all liability and warranties with respect to software subject to a Public License.


6. Disclaimer of Warranties. THE SOFTWARE AND ANY ASSOCIATED DOCUMENTATION IS BEING PROVIDED TO END USER WITHOUT CHARGE FOR THE PERMITTED USE ONLY, AND IS THEREFORE BEING PROVIDED “AS IS”. CALIX EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ANY AND ALL OTHER REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES, EITHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED, STATUTORY, OR OTHERWISE, WITH RESPECT THERETO, INCLUDING ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, TITLE, NON-INFRINGEMENT, OR THE CONTINUOUS, UNINTERRUPTED, ERROR-FREE, VIRUS-FREE, OR SECURE ACCESS TO OR OPERATION OF THE SOFTWARE. CALIX EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ANY WARRANTY AS TO THE ACCURACY OR COMPLETENESS OF ANY INFORMATION OR DATA ACCESSED OR USED IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE AND ANY ASSOCIATED DOCUMENTATION. Calix is not responsible for any delays, delivery failures, or any other loss or damage resulting from the transfer of data over communications networks and facilities, including the Internet, and End User acknowledges that the Software and any associated documentation may be subject to limitations, delays and other problems inherent in the use of such communications facilities.


7. Indemnity. End User agrees to defend, at its expense, Calix (and its officers, directors, employees and agents) against any third-party claim to the extent such claim arises from or is made in connection with End User’s breach of Sections 2(i), 4 or 10, or End User’s negligence or willful misconduct, and End User shall pay all costs and damages finally awarded against Calix by a court of competent jurisdiction as a result of any such claim.


8. Limitation of Liability. IN NO EVENT SHALL CALIX BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE, SPECIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, INCLUDING DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF REVENUES OR PROFITS, LOSS OF USE, BUSINESS INTERRUPTION, OR LOSS OF DATA, WHETHER IN AN ACTION IN CONTRACT OR TORT, EVEN IF IT HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. IN NO EVENT SHALL CALIX’S TOTAL LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS Calix Gingamanage EXCEED $100.00 US.


9. Privacy. By accepting this Calix Gingamanage, End User agrees to the Calix Website Terms of Use located at https://www.calix.com/pages/terms-of-use.html and to the Calix Privacy Policy located at https://www.calix.com/content/calix/en/site-prod/home/pages/privacy-policy.html. End User acknowledges that Calix may collect certain usage metrics through the Software to enhance and/or evaluate the Software from time to time. End User grants Calix a worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free license to use and incorporate into the Software any suggestion, enhancement request or other feedback provided by End User relating to the Software.


10. U.S. Export Compliance. The Software, along with any associated documentation and other technology we may make available to End User in connection with the Software, may be subject to export laws and regulations of the United States. End User represents that neither End User nor any additional authorized user is named on any U.S. government denied-party list. End User further agree that End User will immediately terminate a user’s access to the Software if such user becomes the subject of any U.S. government denied-party list. End User shall not permit its authorized users to access or use any Software in a U.S.-embargoed country (currently, the Crimea Region of Ukraine, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan and Syria) or otherwise in violation of any U.S. export law or regulations.


11. MISCELLANEOUS. This Calix Gingamanage shall be governed by and construed under the laws of the State of California, United States of America. The parties consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the courts located in and serving San Francisco, California. Failure by either party to exercise any of its rights under, or to enforce any provision of, this Calix Gingamanage will not be deemed a waiver or forfeiture of such rights or ability to enforce such provision. If any provision of this Calix Gingamanage is held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be illegal, invalid or unenforceable, such provision will be amended to achieve as nearly as possible the same economic effect of the original provision and the remainder of this Calix Gingamanage will remain in full force and effect. This Calix Gingamanage represents the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes any previous or contemporaneous oral or written agreements or communications regarding the subject matter of this Calix Gingamanage. The person accepting this Calix Gingamanage for End User represents that such person is duly authorized by all necessary and appropriate corporate action to enter into this Calix Gingamanage on behalf of End User. Any modification to this Calix Gingamanage must be in writing and signed by a duly authorized agent of both parties. No joint venture, partnership, employment, or agency relationship exists between the parties as a result of this Calix Gingamanage or use of the Software. End User may not assign this Calix Gingamanage and any purported assignment in violation of this section shall be void. Calix may assign, transfer, or subcontract this Calix Gingamanage in whole or in part. Calix may give notice to End User by electronic mail to End User’s email address on record in End User’s account information. End User may give notice to Calix at any time by any letter delivered by nationally recognized overnight delivery service or first class postage prepaid mail to Calix at Calix, Inc., Attention: Legal, 100 Headquarters Drive, San Jose, CA 95134-1370, United States of America, with courtesy copy to calixlegal@calix.com. A party may, by giving notice, change its applicable address, email, or other contact information. Notice will be deemed to have been given upon the expiration of 36 hours after mailing (if sent by first class mail) or sending by courier or 12 hours after sending (if sent by email), or, if earlier, when received.


Appendix A


Subscriber Data Collection and Usage in Calix Gigamanage


What information do we collect?


Calix Gigamanage is an intuitive, easy-to-use mobile application that lets subscribers set up a guest Wi-Fi network, set parental controls, provide basic policy management and associate devices in the network to household members.


In order to provide these services, Calix Gigamanage may use the following subscriber configuration information: 
• E-mail address 
• Mapping of devices associated to a household member, including subscriber created labels to designate such devices 
• SSID settings – username and password for primary SSIDs 
• SSID settings – username and password for guest SSIDs


How is subscriber information used within Calix Gigamanage?


Calix Gigamanage uses the information provided in the application and collected from subscriber’s residential gateway device to enforce and display subscriber-configured policies.
